channel.title: Modular style patch
channel.description: Just wondering if anyone could share any patches/tutorials on building modular type synths. I may be missing some in the community but any pointers would be greatly appreciated!

item.title: Modular style patch
item.dc:creator: @hitachii Hitachii
item.description:
@hitachii wrote:

Looks like you've posted your Axoloti for sale, but if this is still useful to you I suggest you put aside a few hours and go through the tutorial section in the Axoloti menu. You can get there with File > Library > Factory > then Demo or Tutorials. The Tutorials are great because they'll teach you how the parts work on synths in general. It shows some real helpful stuff that extends to Eurorack or basically any type of synth.

I actually learned a lot about how synths work in general using the Moog Minataur-inspired patch someone made linked here:

First attempt at patching a useful instrument - Moog Minitaur

Part 4 - Axoctrl Ok, problems solved. I got the soldering issues figured out and while I'm waiting for the OLED 3306 screen to arrive (didn't know they made ones with the VCC and ground pins swapped?!?), I put the unit together and did some basic coding on the patch. [image] Replacing the inputs with those from the Axoctrl is pretty straightforward, but I have a couple of questions below that maybe someone can help me figure out what the best approach is. First things first, I'm strugglinâ€¦

You can replace the Axocontrol object with the analog ins of the current box that you have to get controlling it right away (or save that part for later and just poke around the patch). With the knowledge that you get from the tutorial you'll begin to see parts of this patch where you think "Hmmm, a wavefolder would sound good here" or other things.

Totally understandable if you're not gelling with the Axo, but if you were still looking to learn, you'll never run out of things to do!

Read full topic
